title: Stan Wawrinka Gets Special Invite to Australian Open in His Last Year
summary: Stan Wawrinka is a famous tennis player who has won big tournaments called Grand Slams. He is 40 years old and will retire after the 2026 season. The Australian Open, a major tennis event, gave him a wildcard, which is a special invitation to play even though he is not ranked high enough. Wawrinka is happy because he won his first Grand Slam title at the Australian Open in 2014. Another player, Nick Kyrgios, decided not to play singles because he is not ready for long matches. He will play doubles instead. This helps the tournament director avoid a tough decision about who gets the last wildcards.

background_read: Tennis is a sport where players hit a ball over a net. There are big tournaments called Grand Slams, like the Australian Open. Players can get wildcards to enter if they are famous or have done well before. Some players retire when they get older. Doubles is when two players team up against another pair.
Article_Structure: WHO: Stan Wawrinka and Nick Kyrgios, two tennis players
WHAT: Wawrinka gets a wildcard to the Australian Open in his final season, while Kyrgios chooses to play doubles instead of singles
WHERE: The Australian Open tournament in Australia
WHY: Wawrinka is grateful for the chance to play one last time, and Kyrgios is not ready for long matches, helping the tournament director make a decision
